thread.title: Tottenham stars Dele Alli, Christian Eriksen and Harry Kane train ahead of Spurs’ crucial Europa League second-leg clash
thread.title_full: Tottenham stars Dele Alli, Christian Eriksen and Harry Kane train ahead of Spurs’ crucial Europa League second-leg clash

author: dfraser
title: Tottenham stars Dele Alli, Christian Eriksen and Harry Kane train ahead of Spurs’ crucial Europa League second-leg clash

organizations.name: bayer leverkusen in group e.  despite

text:
Comments TOTTENHAM have been training ahead of their Europa League last-32 second leg with Gent on Tuesday. 
Spurs are trailing 1-0 from the first leg in Belgium, knowing nothing less than a win will be enough to reach the last-16 in Europe. Getty Images 7 Christian Eriksen was all smiles ahead of Tottenham’s crunch European tie 
But the players looking in fine form as they were put through their paces at their base in Enfield. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
Christian Eriksen and Kieran Trippier were spotted laughing their way through the session – as were Victor Wanyama and Kyle Walker . 
Dele Alli showed off his fancy footwork with some neat control, while the rest of their squad went through their drills, as the game crept to just two days away. Fulham 0-3 Tottenham : Harry Kane hat-trick fires Spurs into the FA Cup last eight Getty Images Victor Wanyama and Kyle Walker share a joke in Tottenham training Getty Images Dele Alli shows off his fancy footwork ahead of the Gent clash Getty Images 7 Tottenham players are put through their paces at their Enfield base on Tuesday 
Tottenham would have been hoping to have enjoyed a better year in Europe - especially playing their home games at Wembley instead of White Hart Lane . 
However, their disappointing Champions League campaign saw them lose three of their game to finish third behind Monaco and Bayer Leverkusen in Group E. 
Despite looking on course to seal a Champions League spot for next season based on their Premier League position, Mauricio Pochettino would have been hoping for a run in Europe's second tier. Getty Images Kieran Trippier enjoys a laugh ahead of the second leg against Gent Getty Images Tottenham know nothing less than a win will do at Wembley on Thursday Getty Images 7 Harry Kane and Co watch on as Dele Alli is put through his paces 
Yet the surprise 1-0 defeat in Belgium means they'll not only need to go out to score, but also keep it tight at the back or risk being dumped out on away goals. 
Spurs have been in poor form recently, despite their 3-0 FA Cup win over Fulham on Sunday. 
Before that, the loss to Gent followed a 2-0 defeat to Liverpool, a scraped win over struggling Middlesbrough and a draw to lowly Sunderland.
